item.title: Mi mama me lo teje todo
item.description: å¼€å§‹åªæ˜¯ ä¸€åªç®€å•è¢œå­ ç”¨æ¥é®è”½ æˆ‘éº»æœ¨çš„è„šä¸« ç¾Šæ¯›åšçš„ æ˜¯ç¾ä¸½çš„ç´«è‰² å°å¿ƒç¿¼ç¿¼ ç”¨é’©é’ˆé’©å‡ºæ¥ ç„¶åå¦ˆå¦ˆ ç»‡å¦ä¸€åªè¢œå­ å› ä¸ºå¯’å†· å•ƒå™¬å¦ä¸€åªè„š ç»‡çš„æ›´é•¿ ä½†ä¹Ÿæ›´çª„ è¿˜ä¸æ˜¯ç´«è‰²çš„ æ˜¯å’–å•¡è‰² ä»é‚£ä¸€åˆ»å¼€å§‹ å†æ²¡åœä¸‹æ¥è¿‡ ååœ¨ç”µè§†æœºå‰ å¥¹ç»‡ï¼Œå¥¹ç»‡ï¼Œå¥¹ç»‡ æˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆç»™æˆ‘ç¼–ç»‡ä¸€åˆ‡ æˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆç¼–ç»‡æ‰‹è‰ºå·® å¥¹ç»™æˆ‘ç»‡äº†ä¸€æ¡é•¿å›´å·¾ æŠŠè·¯è¿‡çš„äººéƒ½ç»™ç»Šå€’ è¿˜ç»™æˆ‘ä¸€é¡¶è®©æˆ‘å¤´ç–¼çš„ç¼–ç»‡å¸½ å¥¹ç»™æˆ‘ç»‡äº†ä¸ªè¶…å¤§æ‰‹å¥— ç°åœ¨æˆ‘æŠŠå®ƒå½“å¸½å­æˆ´ å› ä¸ºé‚£ä¸ªç–¯å©†å­ç»‡äº†å…­æ ¹æ‰‹æŒ‡ æˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆç»™æˆ‘ç¼–ç»‡ä¸€åˆ‡ æˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆç¼–ç»‡æ‰‹è‰ºå·® å¥¹ç»‡äº†ä¸ªåº•éƒ¨æ‰“å¼€çš„ä¹¦åŒ… æˆ‘çš„ä½œä¸šæœ¬éƒ½å·²ç»è§é¬¼å»äº† å¥¹åšäº†ä»¶è¢–é•¿åˆ°è‚˜çš„èƒŒå¿ƒ ç„¶åä»–ä»¬å°±å«æˆ‘å¼—å…°é‡‘æ–¯å¦ æˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆï¼Œæˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆï¼Œæˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆ æˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆï¼Œæˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆï¼Œæˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆ æ±‚ä½ å¿«åœæ‰‹å¦ˆå¦ˆ å†ç»‡æˆ‘å°±è¦çˆ†ç‚¸ å¥¹çœ‹ç€æˆ‘çœ¼ç¥å……æ»¡äº†æ€€ç–‘ å¥¹è¯´è¿™æ ·å§å„¿å•Š ç”¨ä¸ç€è·Ÿæˆ‘å–Šè¯ æˆ‘ç»™ä½ ç¼–ç»‡æ˜¯å› ä¸ºæˆ‘çˆ±ä½ æˆ‘çˆ±ä½ ï¼Œæˆ‘çˆ±ä½ å’±ä¿©æ˜¯æ£’é’ˆå’Œç¾Šæ¯›çš„å…³ç³» æˆ‘çˆ±ä½ ï¼Œæˆ‘çˆ±ä½ ä½ ä¸å–œæ¬¢æˆ‘å°±ç»‡ç»™ä½ å¦¹å¦¹ ï¼ˆå¦¹å¦¹ï¼šï¼‰ä¸â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€”â€” æˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆç»™æˆ‘ç¼–ç»‡ä¸€åˆ‡ æˆ‘å¦ˆå¦ˆç¼–ç»‡æ‰‹è‰ºå·® æˆ‘çš„å¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆâ€”â€” æˆ‘çš„å¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆå¦ˆâ€”â€”

item.title: Journal 2022-07-05
item.description: Today is the first day I went back office. The office computer is behaving weird. The LCD won’t light up during startup. I may need to get it fixed another day. And of course, I went for the wrong direction while taking the metro home.

item.title: Journal 2022-07-04
item.description: Biking has cured my back pain. I should do it more! Bought Mi 12s today. Went for the max config. Hope it won’t disappoint me.

item.title: Journal 2022-07-02
item.description: Weekend. Ate some good lunch w/ family. Long afternoon naps. 20km biking with wyh in the evening. The summer evening breeze is quite enjoyable. Things to buy: A folding bike. So hard to choose. A phone. Probably Mi 11 in 7/4.

item.title: Journal 2022-07-01
item.description: So the first half of the year consists of the lockdown, the work-from-home, and the generally slacking of because of my mental status. This should not continue. From the first day of the second half of the year, I will try to do more, like writing useless journals about what I do. This shall be the first, and this is what I did today: Introduced my son to the Chinese version of Hikaru No Go.

item.title: Remember to update playwright scripts
item.description: We’ve had a repo that uses playwright for testing. The test runs daily with Jenkins and Docker. It’s been quite stable and haven’t been updated for a good year. Yesterday I tried to update playwright to the most recent version, but after updating, CI stopped working: â•”â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•— â•‘ Host system is missing a few dependencies to run browsers. â•‘ â•‘ Please install them with the following command: â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ sudo npx playwright install-deps â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ â•‘ <3 Playwright Team â•‘ â•šâ•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â•â• I did feel the love from Playwright team.

item.title: Weekly Reading 2021-06-06
item.description: Chinese Language If you want to read classical Chinese text printed or hand copied centuries ago: ä¸­å›½å¤ç±ä¿æŠ¤ç½‘ is a project of the National library that incorporates all the links to local libraries that have open-access scans of classical books. It’s not that open though. Some of them requires you to have an account. æ±‰å…¸é‡å…‰ is a project by Alibaba that aims to digitize the rare classical copies. It mainly focuses on the books that are located abroad.

item.title: Learning Rust 01
item.description: Recently I’m trying to learn rust by rewriting one of my typescript libraries into rust. The purpose of the articles is that I record myself sorting things out and trying to understand stuff. They are mostly memos or notes that I serve myself. Though i’d be glad if you find it interesting, and even happier if you could point out errors and directions. Cheers. The project I’m rewriting is silabacion. It divides Spanish words into syllables, and tries to provide as many phonetic features as possible.

item.title: Learning Rust 02
item.description: Today I found an implementation of is_vowel by BartMassey. It’s a much advanced implementation. I’ll try to analyze the code. Bear in mind that there is still much that I don’t know or understand. External dependencies The Cargo.toml indicates that two external dependencies are used: once_cell that provides cell-like types. unicode-normalization that does what the name says. What is a cell-like type? See std::cell. It’s “shareable mutable container”, and the rest is a blur.

item.title: 24 Days of Hanzi
item.description: Preface 24 Days of Hanzi for Christmas 2020, originally published in Twitter. Day 1 #24DaysOfHanzi å’– Have you noticed that å’– is pronounced kÄ in å’–å•¡(kÄfÄ“i, coffee), and gÄ in å’–å–±(gÄli, curry)? I didn’t notice until yesterday, though I already knew. Human brains are funny devices. The word å’–å–± doesn’t sound much like the English “curry”, to the point that for long I’ve had a misconception that garlic means å’–å–±. Now that I know å’–å–± is the phonetic translation of the Tamil word “kari”, I feel much better.
